channel.title: StockHedges
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from StockHedges, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: UBS Extends Its U.S. Wealth Arm to Serve More Than Just the Ultrarich
item.description: Chasing higher margins, and rivals, the bank’s U.S. boss is making a move for more clients and banking services.

item.title: Gold Closes Back In On $2,700/oz
item.description: Front-month gold futures settled up 1.2%, at $2,697.60 an ounce, its third consecutive gain and the highest close in over two weeks.

item.title: Ulta Beauty shares pop as retailer beats earnings expectations despite demand fears
item.description: The retailer hiked its full-year outlook slightly to reflect the better-than-expected results.

item.title: Oracle shares suffer steepest drop of 2024 after earnings miss
item.description: Oracle shares fell on Tuesday following disappointing quarterly results from the database software company.

item.title: Lululemon stock jumps as international growth helps to offset slowing U.S. sales
item.description: Lululemon has been in a bit of a rough spot after the departure of its longtime Chief Product Officer Sun Choe.

item.title: U.S. Natural Gas Futures Settle Near Flat
item.description: Natural gas futures recovered from early losses and ended the session little changed as the market moved with volatile winter weather forecasts. The N...

item.title: Shares of American Eagle plunge 13% as company issues weak holiday guidance
item.description: American Eagle issued weak holiday guidance after reporting its third sales miss in a row.

item.title: Walgreens Is in Talks to Sell Itself to Private-Equity Firm Sycamore Partners
item.description: Deal would cap tumultuous run for retailer whose market value shrank from a peak of over $100 billion to below $8 billion.

item.title: Oracle shares slide on earnings and revenue miss, disappointing forecast
item.description: Oracle shares fell Tuesday morning after the database software company issued disappointing quarterly results.

item.title: Nasdaq, S&P 500 Slip; Oracle Stock Sells Off
item.description: The S&P 500, Nasdaq Composite and Dow Jones Industrial Average all slipped as investors’ obsession with technology cut both ways.
